com.betleopard

Interface DomainFactory<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the domain type to be built
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HazelcastFactory, HazelcastHorseFactory, SimpleFactory, SimpleHorseFactory

    public interface DomainFactory<T>
    High-level interface to describe the domain object factories - allows pluggable implementations (including Hazelcast, simple Java 8, Spark)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean cacheIfSupported(T t)
      Factories may optionally support caching.
      T getByID(long ID)
      The factory implictly expects lookup by an ID field to be possible
      default T getByName(java.lang.String name)
      Retrieving an object by name may or may not be possible, this default exists merely for interface convenience.
      long getNext()
      Factories are expected to manage a long-indexed list of which objects they have created.

    • Method Detail

      • getByID

        T getByID(long ID)
        The factory implictly expects lookup by an ID field to be possible
        Parameters:
        ID - the ID of the requested object
        Returns:
        the corresponding object

      • getByName

        default T getByName(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieving an object by name may or may not be possible, this default exists merely for interface convenience.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the instance to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the corresponding object, or null

      • cacheIfSupported

        default boolean cacheIfSupported(T t)
        Factories may optionally support caching. This method attempts to cache an object of type T
        Parameters:
        t - the object for which caching should be attempted
        Returns:
        true if the factory supports caching and this object was cached

      • getNext

        long getNext()
        Factories are expected to manage a long-indexed list of which objects they have created. This method returns the next object ID.
        Returns:
        the index of the next object to be generated
